results.title: Port Fairy Connections
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Essie Warmuth introduces us to the various social, political and community groups that thrive in Port Fairy. There’s the bike group that rides every morning, rain, hail or shine. Next we go indoors to visit a book club that has entertained and engaged a group of women for over 30 years. These women have shared books, births, weddings and funerals over the years. Finally, a community action group, in collaboration with the local IGA, devoted to stamping out the use of plastic bags in Port Fairy. These groups illustrate the diverse interests of this small town as well as creating a strong sense of community for the locals.

results.title: Respect and Belonging
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Learn about the Lake Tyres Indigenous community and the interesting life of elder; Aunty Phyllis Andy. As a respected Elder, pastor and community health worker, Aunty Phyllis Andy feels a strong connection not only to the land but the people that live within it. She understands the importance of connecting with the next generation and uses storytelling to pass on respect and culture to the young indigenous people of her community.

results.title: Deen Maar: Past, Present & Future
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Geoff Clarke takes us on a tour of the Deen Maar property and explains why the island and the land is such a significant location for the local Indigenous people and is of importance to the Yambuk area. He discusses the challenge of incorporating modern industry on such a sensitive site, installing wind turbines on the land, which generates an economic return for the community while achieving a compromise in protecting the cultural significance of the site.

He discusses the challenge of incorporating modern industry on such a sensitive site, installing wind turbines on the land, which generates an economic return for the community while achieving a compromise in protecting the cultural significance of the site.

results.title: Dur-e Dara
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.

Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.

results.title: Brendan Smith : making a difference in Rutherglen
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: A self proclaimed ‘Average Joe’, Brendan Smith offers his insatiable enthusiasm and passion for all things audio visual, installing professional standard lighting and sound equipment in Rutherglen’s local hall, making it possible for everyone in the community to connect with the arts.

results.title: Strong and Proud
results.creator_credit: Darren Atkinson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Darren grew up on Cummeragunja Mission and in this digital story he talks about his grandfather’s life, the Koori community and the handing down of Indigenous traditions and culture from one generation to the next.

results.title: Crafts in Yackandandah
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Inspired by the changing landscape, the availability of raw materials and a sense of community, various talented crafts practitioners call Yackandandah home. From internationally recognised potter John Dermer and local weaver Jan Clements, to Christine Thorpe owner of Spiritus Gallery we are introduced to wood carvers, guitar makers and jewellery designers.

results.title: Black ash
results.brief_description: An account of a typical ‘lazy day’ by the river in Warburton which suddenly turns nasty when Bonnie and her friends realise the gravity of the fire. She recounts her anxiety and wanting to leave Warburton and her frustration at her family’s indecisions. She is stuck in Lysterfield after they evacuate with 17 people.

results.title: Young Philly
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Phillip is a 20-year-old Hip Hop artist from Mildura who won the prestigious Noel Tovey Achievement Award in 2010 (for Emerging Artist). Despite having a difficult start in life, Phil is intent on living a positive life and breaking the negative stereotypes associated with young Aboriginal people. He shares his passion for rapping with a desire to become a youth worker in the hopes of one day establishing a youth centre for Indigenous kids in Mildura.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, David Withers and ACMI

results.title: Artists of Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. In this film we meet painters, photographers and musicians who talk about what drew them to the area, how the weather informs their work and how the community inspire each other.
